steps.title: Open Windows Firewall with Advance Security.
steps.content: Open Windows Firewall with Advance Security.

steps.title: Under Rule Type, select Ports.
steps.content: Under Rule Type, select Ports. Click on Next.

steps.title: Select TCP.
steps.content: Select TCP. Then enter the ports used by your VNC. Default is 5900 and 5800.

steps.title: Select Block Connection.
steps.content: Select Block Connection. Hit Next all the way to the end of the wizard.

steps.title: Look for VNC Server and hit Properties.
steps.content: Look for VNC Server and hit Properties.

steps.title: Stop the service.
steps.content: Stop the service. You may also select Disable service.

steps.title: Go to Control Panel > Program and Features.
steps.content: Go to Control Panel > Program and Features.

steps.title: Unplug your network cable physically from the computer.
steps.content: Unplug your network cable physically from the computer.

steps.title: Disable NIC.
steps.content: Disable NIC. Go to Control Panel > Network Settings > Right click on your connection > Disable.
